newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX Hub natgas called lower amid softer cash.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX Hub natgas called lower amid softer cash.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natgas futures were called to open lower Thursday following a weaker ACCESS session and early talk of softer cash prices, industry sources said.
June over-the-counter trade ranged from $2.30 to $2.32 after settling Wednesday at $2.353 per million British thermal units (mmBtu).
On ACCESS, June last traded 4.8 cents lower at $2.305.
Early cash prices at the Henry Hub, La., were talked a few cents lower at $2.27-2.30 per mmBtu.

Technically, traders pegged resistance in June at the new high of $2.43 and then at $2.47-50. Support was seen first at $2.20, with major buying likely at $2.05 and then along the up trendline around $2.04.

In Wednesday's cash market, Gulf Coast swing prices firmed 10 cents to about $2.30. Midcon pipes were up a similar amount to $2.10-15. New York city gate gas firmed more than five cents to about $2.60.
Temperatures throughout most of the East and Midwest are expected to drop below normal into this weekend before turning milder early next week, Weather Services Corp.

AGA said late Wednesday that U.S. gas stocks rose last week by 46 bcf, within the 40-50 bcf expected range, and were still 206 bcf, or 30 percent over year-ago. Eastern storage gained 28 bcf and remained 130 bcf, or 50 percent, over 1996 levels.
